channel.title: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Transcript: Iranian Foreign Minister Zarif's Full NPR Interview
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep interviews Iranian Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif on the U.S.'s approach to combating extremist groups in Iraq and Syria and Iran's nuclear weapons program talks.
item.content:encoded:
NPR's Steve Inskeep interviews Iranian Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif on the U.S.'s approach to combating extremist groups in Iraq and Syria and Iran's nuclear weapons program talks.

» E-Mail This

item.title: The Insights Of An Ebola Doctor Who Became A Patient
item.description: Dr. Kent Brantly, the American Ebola survivor, tells NPR what it was like to suffer from the deadly and "humiliating" disease.
item.content:encoded:
Dr. Kent Brantly, the American Ebola survivor, tells NPR what it was like to suffer from the deadly and "humiliating" disease.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: Obama Renews Pledge To Keep Combat Forces Out Of Iraq, Syria
item.description: President Obama's remarks came as Congress votes to approve more military trainers in the region to aide the fight against the group that calls itself the Islamic State.
item.content:encoded:
President Obama's remarks came as Congress votes to approve more military trainers in the region to aide the fight against the group that calls itself the Islamic State.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Mara Liasson

item.title: Iran Foreign Minister: Any Deal With Iran Better Than Nothing
item.description: Robert Siegel talks with Steve Inskeep about the Morning Edition host's recent interview with Iranian Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif. Zarif said Iran is "ready" to make a deal with the U.S. about its nuclear program, and that "any deal with Iran would be better than nothing."
item.content:encoded:
Robert Siegel talks with Steve Inskeep about the Morning Edition host's recent interview with Iranian Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif. Zarif said Iran is "ready" to make a deal with the U.S. about its nuclear program, and that "any deal with Iran would be better than nothing."

» E-Mail This

item.title: MacArthur Grantee Recognized For Advocacy Of Domestic Workers
item.description: Among the scientists, artists and academics awarded this year's MacArthur grants is labor organizer Ai-jen Poo. Poo was recognized for her advocacy of domestic workers: housekeepers, nannies and other caregivers who are often underpaid and not protected by labor law. Robert Siegel talks with her about her work.
item.content:encoded:
Among the scientists, artists and academics awarded this year's MacArthur grants is labor organizer Ai-jen Poo. Poo was recognized for her advocacy of domestic workers: housekeepers, nannies and other caregivers who are often underpaid and not protected by labor law. Robert Siegel talks with her about her work.

» E-Mail This

item.title: On Scotland's Referendum, Poor Lean Toward Indpendence
item.description: London-based pollster Martin Boon tells Robert Siegel that in Scotland's upcoming referendum, the poor regions of cities are leaning toward independence while the elite are in favor of maintaining ties to England.
item.content:encoded:
London-based pollster Martin Boon tells Robert Siegel that in Scotland's upcoming referendum, the poor regions of cities are leaning toward independence while the elite are in favor of maintaining ties to England.

» E-Mail This

item.title: After A Long Wait, Syrian Rebels Hope The Weapons Will Now Flow
item.description: The "moderate" opposition has been losing ground on the battlefield and pleading for weapons from the U.S. for the past couple of years. They are hoping that their fortunes have finally changed.
item.content:encoded:
The "moderate" opposition has been losing ground on the battlefield and pleading for weapons from the U.S. for the past couple of years. They are hoping that their fortunes have finally changed.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Deborah Amos

item.title: From Quebec To Kashmir, Separatists Watch Scotland Vote
item.description: Scotland's referendum on independence has implications beyond the borders of the United Kingdom. We take a look at several other regions with breakaway movements.
item.content:encoded:
Scotland's referendum on independence has implications beyond the borders of the United Kingdom. We take a look at several other regions with breakaway movements.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Krishnadev Calamur

item.title: Iran's Foreign Minister: U.S. 'Not Serious' About Defeating Islamic State
item.description: In an interview with NPR, Mohammad Javad Zarif says the U.S. has been hesitant and contradictory in its approach to defeating the Islamist insurgency.
item.content:encoded:
In an interview with NPR, Mohammad Javad Zarif says the U.S. has been hesitant and contradictory in its approach to defeating the Islamist insurgency.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Who's Giving What: Nonprofits Step Up Anti-Ebola Efforts
item.description: Nonprofits have an important role to play in fighting Ebola, Obama said yesterday. Indeed, they are now donating millions, dispatching doctors and sending over critical supplies.
item.content:encoded:
Nonprofits have an important role to play in fighting Ebola, Obama said yesterday. Indeed, they are now donating millions, dispatching doctors and sending over critical supplies.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Linda Poon

item.title: Obama Rules Out Another Ground War In Iraq
item.description: The president said U.S. airstrikes, combined with military expertise, would be more effective in defeating the group that calls itself the Islamic State.
item.content:encoded:
The president said U.S. airstrikes, combined with military expertise, would be more effective in defeating the group that calls itself the Islamic State.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Krishnadev Calamur

item.title: Mistura Food Fest Gives Peruvian Cuisine A Chance To Shine
item.description: Every September, top chefs from around the world gather to celebrate the diversity of Peruvian cuisine. But not everyone is convinced the food boom is the answer to the country's historic challenges.
item.content:encoded:
Every September, top chefs from around the world gather to celebrate the diversity of Peruvian cuisine. But not everyone is convinced the food boom is the answer to the country's historic challenges.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Mollie Bloudoff-Indelicato

item.title: For Scotland's 16-Year-Olds, The First Vote Will Be On Independence
item.description: Scotland has lowered the voting age from 18 to 16 for Thursday's referendum on independence. But it looks like the youngest voters won't be casting ballots in the way that many had initially expected.
item.content:encoded:
Scotland has lowered the voting age from 18 to 16 for Thursday's referendum on independence. But it looks like the youngest voters won't be casting ballots in the way that many had initially expected.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Ari Shapiro

item.title: Bangladesh Court Commutes Islamist Leader's Death Sentence
item.description: Delwar Hossain Sayedee will instead spend the rest of his life in prison. He was convicted last year for his role in the violence surrounding the 1971 war of independence from Pakistan.
item.content:encoded:
Delwar Hossain Sayedee will instead spend the rest of his life in prison. He was convicted last year for his role in the violence surrounding the 1971 war of independence from Pakistan.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Krishnadev Calamur

item.title: House Poised To Vote On Arming, Training Syrian Rebels
item.description: The expected vote on whether to authorize the Obama administration's plan to arm and train moderate fighters comes as the president meets with military officials at U.S. Central Command.
item.content:encoded:
The expected vote on whether to authorize the Obama administration's plan to arm and train moderate fighters comes as the president meets with military officials at U.S. Central Command.
